content.description: Looks like choss, actually climbs well. Use small pocket and crimp to a jug. Top out through slopers.
content.protection: Anchors are on the shelf below the top. Be careful scrambling down to set anchors.
content.location: Right of 'Just Say No' and the dihedral.

content.description: Seldom climbed slab marked by top rope bolts three feet below the lip.
content.protection: Bolts below the lip accessible only through thick cactus. Avoid.

content.description: Hardest TR at Lake Brownwood. Starts on shouldery gastons and laybacks. The crux is just below the top. Top out for true send.
content.protection: Anchors are just over the lip.
content.location: Left of the arete on 'Just Say No.'

content.description: A big pocket marks the beginning of this route. Some choss
content.protection: Anchors are on the shelf below the top. Be careful scrambling down to set anchors.
content.location: Route farthest right of 'Just Say No'

content.description: Climbs the arete and overhang. Versions have been done staying left or right at the top. Right is 5.9+ straight on is 5.10.
content.protection: Anchors are 15' back from the corner.
content.location: Accessible from the path in front of Cabin 2.

climbs.name: I Didn't Know Your Name Was Alex

content.description: Great technical TR. Follows small fingertip crack. Start on matched jug. Move through small sidepull and pocket up to the crack. Finish with a lunge for the ledge.
content.protection: Bolts are above the lip. Don't use bolts on face.
content.location: Left face next to 'This is Your Brain.'

content.description: Climbs the arete. Warm up on the area left of the arete for a good fun climb
Similar to its neighbor, follow pockets and a small crack.
content.location: Middle route on face left of 'This is Your Brain.'

content.description: Sixth area. Best TR problems at the lake. Several climbs intermediate climbers ranging from 5.8- to 5.12-. Problems are all bolted above lip for TR and accessible from top across from Cabin 2.
